alert.note: Alert for Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 19 at 1:54AM CDT until July 19 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Weakley County in west Tennessee... Henry County in west Tennessee... * Until 300 AM CDT. * At 154 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Palmersville, or 16 miles southwest of Murray, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Paris, Cottage Grove, Palmersville, Springville, Routon, Puryear, Henry, Mansfield, Haigler Ridge, Jones Mill, Foundry Hill, Manleyville, Old Springville, Como, India, Mill Creek, Osage, Brundige, Sunnyside and Van Dyke. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
